reviews.positive_text:
We really loved the property. It was very clean and the receptionist was very kind and well behaved.
We were a group of 3 people and we took a sea view triple room, but the view from our balcony was mostly little garden and a spoon of sea. When we discussed this with the receptionist, she informed us that the triple rooms only have this view and they are located at the back building (they have 2 building, one sea facing another behind it).
We were not happy but to compensate it, they offered us free breakfast which was kind of them.
I would also like to bring to the notice that the breakfast was croissant, pain au chocolat, bread and spreads, granola bowl and some fruits with drinks. It was nothing worth of 15‚Ç¨ per person. Not a big buffet you might expect. But it was okay. I recommend the place due to its hospitality, cleanliness and location.

reviews.positive_text: The ambiance of the whole place was perfect as was the warm welcome and attentive service. Thank you Maryse. There are many stairs (around 20-25)to carry luggage and after we asked if there is any other available room, lady at reception told us there is no availability and offered to help. As I understand, there is no standard help about it if you have heavy luggage.

We booked triple room with a sea view and our room was against another building. If you go out to the balcony, stand up and move your head out of balcony, you can see tiny bit of sea. Their room description is abviously a lie and unfair. We arrived late and knew there was no other availability so I talked with them during check out. Lady at reception said that there is a view in that room! It was like a joke, I add the pictures! After I say no there is not, she gave 10 euro discount. 

I booked this hotel because I thought we were going to have a view. I could choose something else if I knew the truth. Room is old, doesn‚Äôt look fresh as in the pictures and with all other things it was a disappointing experience. I‚Äôm happy that it was a short stay.

reviews.positive_text:
Accuratezza e dimensione familiare riescono a convivere in questo hotel di Les Issambres, a pochi chilometri da localit√† come Sainte-Maxime, Port Grimaud e Saint-Tropez (e gi√† tenendo conto di questo il rapporto qualit√†-prezzo non pu√≤ non essere considerato eccellente). L'emblema potrebbe essere rappresentato dal verde del giardino: che l'erba sia sintetica lo scopri solo toccandola, tanto √® stata posizionata e viene conservata con cura. Per il resto, un'esplosione di alberi e fiori veri, ben tenuti, che, unitamente alla piscina e al campo della p√©tanque, ai "salottini" sparsi nell'area e agli arredi scelti con gusto contribuiscono a suscitare proprio un senso di "quietude", pur se il sottofondo del traffico sulla strada costiera, scavalcando il muro di piante, dovrebbe determinare tutt'altro.
Maryse √® una padrona di casa elegante, cordiale, sempre presente e sempre attenta nel cercare di soddisfare anche richieste che maturino man mano...
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per la seconda volta: l'assenza della vista mare completa √® stata in questo caso compensata dalla maggiore spaziosit√† della camera. Per il resto, nuovamente, pulizia garantita e pure la presenza del bidet.
Nessun problema di parcheggio, anche per chi, a differenza nostra, non volesse utilizzare quello interno a pagamento.
La colazione √® adeguata per un tre stelle. Particolare nota di merito per il ristorante, aperto tutte le sere (tranne il marted√¨). Tutti i piatti sono preparati con grande cura ed ottime materie prime: uniscono alla tradizione locale qualche tocco di inventiva. L'affaccio sul giardino (e verso uno scorcio di mare) appaga poi anche la vista.
